key_risks: Legal and tenant disputes, including unresolved payment disputes with Bluesea in China
Exposure to fluctuations in the commercial real estate market, particularly in Singapore and Australia
Tenant concentration risks in key properties
Potential impact of rising interest rates and reduced corporate demand for office space
controversies: DXC Technology lawsuit, resolved with a S$13.3 million settlement
Ongoing payment dispute with Bluesea in China involving $6.8 million in unpaid rent and security deposit top-ups
environmental_issues: Increased operational costs due to sustainability initiatives and Green Mark certifications
social_issues: Tenant support measures during COVID-19, including rental relief and flexible leasing arrangements
governance_issues: Regulatory changes in real estate and tax policies in Singapore and Australia
Focus on ESG considerations and green financing initiatives

sources.title: Singapore High Court rules in favor of Keppel DC REIT over DXC lawsuit
sources.snippet: The lawsuit in question was filed in March 2022. DXC had tried to reduce the amount of floor space it leased from Keppel, but the latter argued that this was not included in the SSA. DXC entered that agreement with Keppel in 2010 for 20,300 sqm (218,500 sq ft) across four modules.
